how to unzip without creating a new dire: there's the -d option to unzip that should help
almost.  unzip file.zip -d .  # . being the current directory
i guess there is no easy way then - if you know the name of the directory in the zip archive, you can do something like the following ...
unzip file.zip -d . && mv directory_name/* . && rm -r directory_name
if you are adding dotfiles into the archive, you need to turn on dotglobbing too
I just broke down and did it with the gui
but yeah there are some hidden things that I might be missing that way
then before you run the command, you need to have this.  shopt -s dotglob
